intro: Dracaena bhitalae, commonly known as the Bhitala dracaena, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Western Ghats of India. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are usually a deep green color. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by red or orange-colored fruits. Dracaena bhitalae is adapted to grow in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in humid, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
